courses.title: Web Development
courses.description: Learn the foundations of building dynamic and responsive web applications.

categories.title: HTML Basics
categories.description: Test your knowledge of HTML structure, tags, and attributes.

questions.question: What is the correct structure of an HTML document?
Which of the following tags is used to define an unordered list in HTML?
Which CSS property is used to change the background color of an element?
What is the correct CSS selector to select an element with the class `container`?
Which input type is used to create a password field in an HTML form?
Which CSS property is used to align items horizontally in a Flexbox container?
What attribute is required to specify the image source in the `` tag?
What does the CSS `box-sizing` property control?
answers: How padding and border are included in the element’s width and height
The position of an element relative to the viewport
The color of the element’s border

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used to define a hyperlink?
Which CSS property is used to position an element relative to its normal position?
Which tag is used to define a row in an HTML table?
Which property is used to define the size of columns in a CSS Grid?

categories.title: CSS Styling
categories.description: Challenge yourself with questions about CSS selectors, properties, and layouts.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to change the text color of an element?
What does the 'z-index' property control?
What is the default value of the `position` property in CSS?
Which CSS property controls the space between the content and the border of an element?

Which selector targets all `

` elements within a container with the class `box`?
How do you apply styles to an element with the class `highlight`?
Which of the following is the correct syntax for a CSS comment?
Which CSS property is used to set the font size of an element?
What does the `float` property do in CSS?
answers: It makes an element move horizontally across the page
It aligns an element to the right or left of its container
It adds margin space to an element
It wraps text around an element

questions.question: What does the `display` property of `inline-block` do?
answers: Makes the element behave like a block-level element
Makes the element behave like an inline element
Allows elements to line up next to each other

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to control the text alignment?
Which CSS property is used to change the font style of text?
Which property is used to set the space between lines of text?
What does the `clear` property do in CSS?
answers: Clears the padding of an element
Clears the margin of an element
Clears the content of an element

categories.title: JavaScript Fundamentals
categories.description: Test your knowledge of JavaScript syntax, functions, loops, and events.

questions.question: What is the correct syntax for a JavaScript function?
Which of the following is NOT a JavaScript data type?
What does the 'let' keyword do in JavaScript?
Which operator is used to assign a value to a variable in JavaScript?
Which event is triggered when a user clicks on an HTML element?
Which of the following is a JavaScript array method to add an item to the end of an array?
What is the correct way to declare a JavaScript object?
Which loop will execute the code block at least once, even if the condition is false?

categories.title: Backend Development
categories.description: Challenge yourself with questions about server-side programming, databases, and APIs.

questions.question: Which of the following is a popular backend programming language?
What is the primary purpose of a REST API?
answers: To send data between server and client using HTTP methods

questions.question: Which HTTP method is used to send data to the server to create a resource?
Which database is known as a NoSQL database?
What is the purpose of the 'Express.js' framework in backend development?
answers: To manage data on the frontend
To handle routing and middleware in Node.js applications

questions.question: Which of the following is a common use of the 'Node.js' runtime environment?
What does the term 'middleware' refer to in a backend context?
answers: The layer between the frontend and backend that processes requests
The frontend components used to display data
The data sent between server and client

questions.question: Which of the following is a popular method for storing user authentication data securely in backend development?

courses.title: Machine Learning
courses.description: Learn the fundamentals and advanced techniques in machine learning, including supervised and unsupervised learning, model evaluation, and more.

categories.title: Supervised Learning
categories.description: Test your knowledge of supervised learning techniques such as classification and regression.

questions.question: Which of the following is a type of supervised learning algorithm?
What does overfitting mean in a machine learning model?
answers: The model is too simple and cannot capture the underlying pattern.
The model fits the training data too well and performs poorly on new data.
The model is too large and cannot be trained properly.
The model uses too few features.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a regression problem?
answers: Predicting the price of a house based on its features.
Classifying emails as spam or not spam.
Identifying the breed of a dog in an image.
Predicting whether a customer will click on an ad.

questions.question: Which technique can help prevent overfitting in a machine learning model?
Which of the following is a commonly used evaluation metric for classification problems?
What is the purpose of a validation set in machine learning?
answers: To train the model on a smaller subset of data
To evaluate the model’s performance on unseen data
To test the model after training

questions.question: What does a confusion matrix show?
answers: The total accuracy of the model
The relationship between training data and target data
The number of correct and incorrect predictions, broken down by class
The error rates of the model

questions.question: Which algorithm is commonly used for classification tasks?
What does gradient descent do in machine learning?
answers: It finds the best possible model by testing all possible solutions.
It adjusts the model’s parameters to minimize the cost function.
It determines the features to use in the model.
It increases the complexity of the model.

questions.question: Which metric is typically used to evaluate a regression model?

categories.title: Unsupervised Learning
categories.description: Test your knowledge of unsupervised learning algorithms, including clustering and dimensionality reduction.

questions.question: Which of the following is a common unsupervised learning algorithm?
What is the primary purpose of K-means clustering?
answers: To predict continuous values based on input data
To classify data points into predefined categories
To reduce the dimensionality of the data
To group data points into clusters based on similarity

questions.question: What does PCA (Principal Component Analysis) do in machine learning?
answers: It reduces the dimensionality of the dataset while preserving most of the variance.
It classifies data into categories based on a training set.
It optimizes the cost function of a supervised model.
It normalizes the data for better performance.

questions.question: Which of the following is a key challenge in unsupervised learning?
answers: Finding the right evaluation metric for the model
Choosing a model that will perform well on new data
Determining the number of clusters in K-means

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a dimensionality reduction technique?
What does hierarchical clustering produce?
answers: A set of clusters based on the distance between points

questions.question: Which of the following is true about unsupervised learning algorithms?
answers: They require labeled data to train.
They can work with unlabeled data and find patterns on their own.
They can only be used for classification tasks.
They are less computationally intensive than supervised learning.

questions.question: In unsupervised learning, how is performance typically evaluated?
answers: By using a test set with labeled data
By visualizing clusters or principal components

categories.title: Model Evaluation and Hyperparameter Tuning
categories.description: Learn about evaluating models and fine-tuning hyperparameters to improve performance.

questions.question: Which method is commonly used to evaluate a machine learning model’s performance?
What is cross-validation used for in machine learning?
answers: To split data into training and test sets
To evaluate a model's generalization ability

questions.question: What is the main goal of hyperparameter tuning?
answers: To increase the number of training data
To find the optimal parameters for a given model

questions.question: Which of the following is a commonly used method for hyperparameter tuning?
What is the effect of using a very high learning rate during model training?
answers: It speeds up training without affecting accuracy.
It may cause the model to converge too quickly and miss the optimal solution.
It makes the model less sensitive to the training data.

questions.question: Which evaluation metric is used to measure how well a regression model fits the data?
What is the purpose of a confusion matrix in model evaluation?
answers: To calculate the accuracy of the model
To summarize the performance of a classification model
To assess the variance of the model

courses.title: Cybersecurity
courses.description: Learn about the fundamentals of cybersecurity, including network security, cryptography, and risk management.

categories.title: Network Security
categories.description: Test your knowledge of securing networks, firewalls, and intrusion detection systems.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a firewall in network security?
answers: To prevent unauthorized access to a network

questions.question: Which of the following is a common method used to detect intrusions in a network?
What is the purpose of a VPN (Virtual Private Network)?
answers: To create a secure connection over a public network

questions.question: Which of the following is a type of attack aimed at intercepting communication between two parties?
What does a Denial of Service (DoS) attack do?
answers: Overloads the system, causing service interruption
Encrypts data to hold it hostage

questions.question: What does the term 'Phishing' refer to in cybersecurity?
answers: The process of stealing credit card information
A type of social engineering attack to deceive individuals into giving sensitive information
An attack that encrypts files and demands a ransom
An attack that floods a network with excessive traffic

questions.question: Which of the following protocols is commonly used to secure communication over the internet?
What is a common technique to prevent unauthorized access to a network?

categories.title: Cryptography
categories.description: Test your knowledge of encryption methods, digital signatures, and cryptographic algorithms.

questions.question: Which of the following is a symmetric encryption algorithm?
What is the main purpose of a digital signature?
answers: To verify the authenticity and integrity of a message

questions.question: Which encryption algorithm is based on the use of public and private keys?
What is the key characteristic of asymmetric encryption?
answers: The same key is used for both encryption and decryption
Different keys are used for encryption and decryption
It does not require any keys
It is faster than symmetric encryption

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a hashing algorithm?
Which protocol is used to secure email communication by encrypting the contents of an email?
Which of the following is true about a hash function?
answers: It can be reversed to obtain the original data.
It produces a fixed-size output regardless of the input size.
It encrypts the data for storage.
It is primarily used to encrypt emails.

questions.question: Which of the following is a widely used cryptographic protocol for securing websites?

categories.title: Risk Management and Threats
categories.description: Learn about identifying and mitigating risks, threat assessment, and cybersecurity policies.

questions.question: What is the first step in risk management for cybersecurity?
What is the purpose of a risk assessment in cybersecurity?
answers: To evaluate the effectiveness of a firewall
To identify vulnerabilities and determine the impact of potential threats

questions.question: What does the term 'Zero-Day' vulnerability refer to?
answers: A vulnerability that is discovered before the vendor releases a patch
A security flaw caused by human error

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a cybersecurity policy?
What is the purpose of an incident response plan?
answers: To outline steps to take when a security breach occurs
To manage user access to network resources

questions.question: What is a typical response to a Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attack?
answers: Increase bandwidth to handle the attack
Use a VPN to secure the connection
Monitor network traffic for abnormal behavior

questions.question: Which of the following is a common practice in risk mitigation?
